revised_title: Magnetic Lines of Equal Variation and Their Changes on the Terrestrial Surface
tldr: The author, Peter Barlow, analyzed the magnetic lines of equal variation and their changes on the terrestrial surface using data from various voyages and surveys. He found that these lines exhibit a regularity that indicates the existence of a law, despite their extraordinary curvatures. Barlow also discussed the progressive change of the magnetic lines and the influence of these changes on the Earth's poles.
